note.p: Death: His home in Lincoln's Inn Fields, London (29 March 1750)
Education: Christ's Hospital;Trinity College, Cambridge; BA (1706), MA (1709), MD (1716); Leyden (admitted 1709)

Career: Fellow of Trinity (1708); Tutor to Mordechai Carey (1708-1709); Headmaster of Royal Grammar School, Newcastle-upon-Tyne (1710-1715); practised in London, acquiring a considerable fortune; Physician to Guy's Hospital (1725-1732); benefactor of Christ's Hospital; published mathematical works under the pseudonym Philalethes Cantabrigiensis
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Venn; Thomas; Munk's Roll
